Issues.Title: Flaky `test_aio` CircleCI job due to size check
Issues.Body:
The `test_aio` CircleCI job sometimes fails false-positively with the payload size error (over 20kb diff):
```
FAIL: Commit c95802f26f80de933f8cf62898115bbe938fff94 uncompressed main-es2015 exceeded expected size by 500 bytes or >1% (expected: 453213, actual: 476811).
 ```
Example of the most recent failure in master [can be found here](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/angular/angular/17542/workflows/f2ff23d5-7841-4a09-8f7b-e7c9e0c72e28/jobs/747016/steps). In that particular case, it was a [docs-only commit](https://github.com/angular/angular/commit/c95802f26f80de933f8cf62898115bbe938fff94).

Restarting the CircleCI job usually fixes the problem.

cc @gkalpak
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Flaky `test_aio` CircleCI job due to size check" (#37699)

Issues.Title: Forms: consider using `ngDevMode` to tree-shake error messages text in prod mode
Issues.Body: In Ivy runtime code, the `ngDevMode` const is used to guard asserts required in dev mode only. We should consider doing the same in Forms package to tree-shake error messages text (which cannot be minified) and some dev mode specific checks. That should help reduce the size of the `forms` package in production mode.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Forms: consider using `ngDevMode` to tree-shake error messages text in prod mode" (#37697)

Issues.Title: Clarify and improve lightweight-injection-tokens.md guide
Issues.Body:
This issue was created to keep track of follow up AIs from https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/36144#pullrequestreview-436209714

I'd like us to follow up on the initial version of the doc after v10 is out and address several key points:

- [ ] the intro into the guide could be more focused "This guide documents a recommended pattern for Angular library authors that ensure that their libraries are optimizable. Angular libraries are often composed of core functionality, as well as optional features. This lightweight injection pattern ensure that the code associated with the optional features unused by a particular application, is optimized away during production builds of this application."
- [ ] some of the headings could be made more clear, I'll defer to @aikidave's guidance on this
- [ ] somewhere early on, we should state that the pattern is applicable to two use-cases: optional features expressed as directives or components that the core part of the librarie queries for via @ContentChild, @ViewChild, etc. and optional dependencies injected into the constructor of a service or a component and flagged with the @Optional() decorator - this guide seems to mix these two use-cases, which results in confusion when the reader reads it. Again - the pattern and the recommendation to use abstract classes are applicable to both scenarios, but we should document them as two distinct use-case and show them off on two different examples.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Clarify and improve lightweight-injection-tokens.md guide" (#37696)

Issues.Title: Angular 7 IE11 View Not Changing when Array Updates works in Chrome/FF - Solution added
Issues.Body:
I am keeping same title so that any one searches, This is the similar old and closed issue https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/30710 reported and i don't see solution, I got a solution i thought of sharing so that others can benefit.

Issue : Angular 7 IE11 Drop Down View Not Changing when Array Updates works in Chrome/FF.

**Solution:** In .html file just add a `[value]="your variable name"`, 
                in code for Example: `<option *ngFor="let employee of employeeDetails" [value]="employee">{{employee}}</option>
`
Hope this is helpful. Thank you
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular 7 IE11 View Not Changing when Array Updates works in Chrome/FF - Solution added" (#37693)

Issues.Title: fix(docs-infra): generic parameter defaults are not preserved in API docs
Issues.Body:
Generic parameter defaults from source code do not show up in API docs.
For example, `class ElementRef<T = any> { ... }` (from the [source code][1]) appears as `class ElementRef<T> { ... }` in the [API docs][2].

[1]: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/71c0363bb576ef909d81882f8ec9c69392e05bd0/packages/core/src/linker/element_ref.ts#L27
[2]: https://v9.angular.io/api/core/ElementRef
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "fix(docs-infra): generic parameter defaults are not preserved in API docs" (#37694)

Issues.Title: Forms: Allow to change updateOn flag dynamically
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request
Expose method to update the "updateOn" strategy after creation of a form control

### Relevant Package
@angular/forms

### Description
Use Case: User can change the strategy with a toggle button
Right now it is not possible to do this after the form was created initially

### Describe the solution you'd like
Add a method to update the "updateOn" property


### Describe alternatives you've considered

- clone the whole formGroup into a new one with the desired updateOn strategy but this has many side-effects
- hard-overwrite the dependsOn getter which seems to work but is ugly and error-prone of course

```
    Object.defineProperty(this.formGroup, 'updateOn', {
      get: () => wantedUpdateStrategy,
      configurable: true
    });
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Forms: Allow to change updateOn flag dynamically" (#37689)

Issues.Title: If Data-binding an empty Array in template, the state will be retained
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/.... ### Is this a regression? ### Description I binding an empty Array in template as below. And click the ADD button to make some changes. When I click the Rebuild button, app-level-1 component will rebuild(its ngOnInit function will be called). And I expect it always input an empty Array into the sub-component. Actually the binding data will be retained. As a comparison, the the binding data in other two component will be reset. ![20200623192341](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15192986/85398439-cfd0c700-b587-11ea-979a-669c1ba34ff5.png) Even if I deepen the level componet, rebuild all of them, the binding data still here, so maybe it stored in the entire angular lifecycle. I found out how bugs happenÔºö 1. a component binding an empty Array in template. 2. push some data into Array. 3. delete the component. (even if delete its grandparent-componet) 4. build a component that is in the same place of Angular tree. the new component binding a Array as the old component instead of empty Array. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-zkdxh1 ## üî• Exception or Error 


Nope
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 


9.1.11
**Anything else relevant?** It happend in Angular 7
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "If Data-binding an empty Array in template, the state will be retained" (#37687)

Issues.Title: refactor(core): delegate `EventEmitter` subscription signatures processing to `Subscriber`
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [x] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
For now `EventEmitter` takes care of the processing subscription signatures.

## What is the new behavior?
Would be better to delegate this processing to `Subscriber` which knows all subscription signatures and how to handle them.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(core): delegate `EventEmitter` subscription signatures processing to `Subscriber`" (#37686)

Issues.Title: fix(core): fake_async_fallback should have the same logic with fake-async
Issues.Body:
PR #37523 failed when trying to use `rxjs delay` operator
inside `fakeAsync`, and the reasons are:

1. we need to import `rxjs-fake-async` patch to make the integration work.
2. since in `angular` repo, the bazel target `/tools/testing:node` not using `zone-testing` bundle,
instead it load `zone-spec` packages seperately, so it causes one issue which is the `zone.js/testing/fake-async`
package is not loaded, we do have a fallback logic under `packages/core/testing` calles `fake_async_fallback`,
but the logic is out of date with `fake-async` under `zone.js` package.
https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/zone.js/lib/testing/fake-async.ts

Now the `fake_async_fallback` didn't handle `patch Date.now` correctly, and this issue has been fixed in `fake-async` under `zone.js` package.

So this PR, I updated the content of `fake_async_fallback` to make it consistent with
`fake-async` to handle `Date.now` patch.

And I will make another PR to try to remove the `fallback` logic.

And the `Angular` application will not have this issue since they all import `zone.js/dist/zone-testing`, only `angular repo` testing may have this issue.

Issues.Title: fix(router): ensure duplicate popstate/hashchange events are handled ‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
‚Ä¶correctly

The current method of handling duplicate navigations caused by 'hashchange' and 'popstate' events for the same url change does not correctly handle cancelled navigations. Because `scheduleNavigation` is called in a `setTimeout` in the location change subscription, the duplicate navigations are not flushed at the same time. This means that if the initial navigation hits a guard that schedules a new navigation, the navigation for the duplicate event will not compare to the correct transition (because we inserted another navigation between the duplicates). See https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/16710#issuecomment-646919529

Fixes #16710

Change summary: 
* Move the 'hashchange' / 'popstate' duplicate nav checks from `scheduleNavigation` to the location subscription. This is where the events are initially handled / detected 
* Use `pairwise` to compare with the previously detected 'hashchange' / 'popstate'
* Save the current router transition id at the time of the location event to aid in comparison
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(router): ensure duplicate popstate/hashchange events are handled ‚Ä¶" (#37674)

Issues.Title: NavigationStart event doesn't fire when browser back/forward button is used
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages as the source of the bug? -->
The issue is caused by package @angular/router



### Description

Browser back/forward doesn't fire NavigationStart event if the following conditions happen

1. Component navigating from has CanDeactivate guard
2. Navigating using router to the same component that the browser button would navigate to
3. Cancel the navigation using the guard
4. Navigate again to the same component using the browser button

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-s3hcel

**Scenario 1:**

1. Observe the console log with every navigation (NavigationStart event is being logged)
2. Click "Go to first"
3. Click "Go to Base"
4. Click "Cancel" in the confirmation message
5. Click the browser back button
6. NavigationStart event is not logged and the confirmation message is not shown and navigation doesn't happen
7. Browser URL is wrong (pointing on base component url), and browser history is messed up

**Scenario 2:**

1. Observe the console log with every navigation (NavigationStart event is being logged)
2. Click "Go to first"
3. Click "Go to Base"
4. Click "Cancel" in the confirmation message
5. Click "Go to Base" again
6. Click "OK" in the confirmation message
7. NavigationStart event is logged and the navigation happen

Browser button is expected to behave like the normal navigation using router.

## üåç  Your Environment

Angular CLI: 9.1.9
Node: 12.18.1
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 9.1.11
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Oh hi there! üòÑ

# üöÄ Feature request
I should be able to add locale specific scripts or assets.
### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [x] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> 
Currently, if you add a configuration like below and do `ng build --configuration=fr,production` then the specified scripts in the configuration are getting added to the output scripts.js. but doing ng build --prod --localize doesn't add them.

```
       "es": {
              "localize": [
                "es"
              ],
              "aot": true,
              "outputPath": "dist/dev/",
              "scripts": [
                "src/kendo/lib/kendo.messages.es-PR.js"
              ]
            },
            "fr": {
              "localize": [
                "fr"
              ],
              "aot": true,
              "outputPath": "dist/dev/",
              "scripts": [
                "src/kendo/lib/kendo.messages.fr-CA.js"
              ]
            }
```

 It would be beneficial of such a feature exists so that I can add scripts or assets that for specific to a locale. 


### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> 
Along with baseHref, can you please allow scripts and assets to be specified in i18n locales section so that ng build --localize and pick them up and do necessary actions?
```
      "i18n": {
        "locales": {
          "en": {
            "translation": "src/locale/messages.en.xlf",
            "baseHref": "/fvorder/en/",
          },
          "es": {
            "translation": "src/locale/messages.es.xlf",
            "baseHref": "/fvorder/es/",
            "script": ["src/kendo/lib/kendo.messages.es-PR.js"]

          },
          "fr": {
            "translation": "src/locale/messages.fr.xlf",
            "baseHref": "/fvorder/fr/",
            "script": ["src/kendo/lib/kendo.messages.fr-CA.js"]
          }
        }
      }
```


### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Work around: Created a script that copies these scripts to respective output language folders and rename it to some common name. Add script tag to src/index.html that references this script.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Allow locale specific scripts to be added under i18n so that ng build --localize can copy them over" (#17995)

Issues.Title: ci: fix dedupe-duplicate-modules flakes
Issues.Body:
Following #17973, which we emitted the stderr when this test failed on CI.

We see that the resolved module order sometimes changes, which is totally fine because of the async nature of the operation.

https://circleci.com/gh/angular/angular-cli/167318#tests/containers/5
```
[DedupeModuleResolvePlugin]: /tmp/angular-cli-e2e-i03vMQ/test-project/node_modules/tslib-1 -> /tmp/angular-cli-e2e-i03vMQ/test-project/node_modules/tslib-1-copy
```

With this change we handle both cases which should eliminate the flakes
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "ci: fix dedupe-duplicate-modules flakes" (#17982)

Issues.Title: 3rdpartylicenses.txt In Additional Formats
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/core


### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Currently the 3rdpartylicenses.txt is generated perfectly fine, and is easy to embed into a web page, however when many libraries are in use the output can be a bit clunky and long, it's not the most user-friendly way to display licenses and a lot can be done to make it more presentable to an end user should they bother to check it out.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Could a way be provided to provide the license information as a JSON array instead.

#### Standard
```
@angular-devkit/build-angular
MIT
The MIT License

Copyright (c) 2017 Google, Inc.

Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy
of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal
in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights
to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell
copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is
furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:

The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all
copies or substantial portions of the Software.

THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR
IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY,
FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE
AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER
LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM,
OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE
SOFTWARE.


@angular/animations
MIT
```

#### Potential JSON Version
```json
[
  {
    "package": "@angular-devkit/build-angular",
    "license": "MIT",
    "content": "The MIT License\n\nCopyright (c) 2017 Google, Inc.\n\nPermission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy\nof this software and associated documentation files (the \"Software\"), to deal\nin the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights\nto use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell\ncopies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is\nfurnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:\n\nThe above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all\ncopies or substantial portions of the Software.\n\nTHE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED \"AS IS\", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR\nIMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY,\nFITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE\nAUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER\nLIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM,\nOUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE\nSOFTWARE."
  },
  {
    "package": "@angular-devkit/build-angular",
    "license": "MIT"
  }
]
```

This would provide much finer control of how the content can be displayed to users, ie using showing each license separately with an [Expansion Panels](https://material.angular.io/components/expansion/overview) or `<details>` HTML tag.

If for legal reasons, it's desirable to always output `3rdpartylicenses.txt`, that's perfectly fine, it'd be nice to just have the `3rdpartylicenses.json` _in addition_, so that the website can serve a text version which can be viewed or downloaded as per normal, but also a JSON version which allows a custom component to be created to display it well.

This could _optionally_ be further expanded by including things like the NPM URL if public/available, GitHub URL if it's visible on NPM, version in use, funding URL if they're seeking funding, etc.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> One could possibly make their own component which reads and parses the `.txt` file manually into an appropriate JSON object and then present it themselves, this would be limited but functional. 

I think providing it this the suggested way would be best however as it's the most expansive and if it's feasible to include package data like version and if it's seeking funding, allows these to be obtained easily at compile time.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "3rdpartylicenses.txt In Additional Formats" (#17970)

Issues.Title: ng serve returns 200 for non-existent files in the assets folder instead of 404 - user gets redirected to the default route
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report - [ ] new - [ ] build - [X] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Y - Was fixed as part of https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/2989 Currently running Angular CLI 6.1.5 for an Angular 6 project and experiencing the same issues ### Description When running ng serve if an image file doesn't exist eg http://localhost:4200/assets/img/filedoesnotexist.jpg instead of returning a 404 response the @angular-devkit/build-angular:dev-server returns a 200 response and redirects to the '' route I think I need to use a custom builder or if there's another fix I'd love to know but at present it is like the webpack dev server doesn't serve anything in the assets as a static file so it runs through routing The fix appears to force accept HTML headers option to webpack dev server. https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/2989 I have the exact issue where if I request a missing image instead of 404ing it returns 200 and tries to redirect to index.html I was wondering how to use this in my angular.json I'm using angular 6 and CLI version 6.1.5 Or if someone knows of a fix I'd love someone to run up a quick sample project with a few routes and some images and have some assets return 404 ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction To test open the ng-test.zip file: https://www.dropbox.com/s/5f9putxrny4kfrk/ng-test.zip?dl=0 1. Run npm i 2. Run ng serve 3. Navigate to http://localhost:4200/assets/icons/trafficlight.png 4. You'll see the image served 5. Navigate to http://localhost:4200/assets/icons/nonexistentfile.png 6. Instead of a 404 you get routed to the home screen ## üî• Exception or Error ## üåç Your Environment 

Angular CLI 6.1.5

Can also reproduce in Angular CLI: 9.1.9 and subsequent latest packages
**Anything else relevant?** Running "builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:dev-server", in angular.json I don't know if the intention of the team is to have people run a custom dev-server instead? I couldn't find anything in the 200 headers returned for a missing asset file to indicate an error or anything it just looks like a normal 200 ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1916426/85363814-2d075100-b565-11ea-9dfd-9a8565878281.png) Here's an example of the fact the dev server a non-existent jpg file as html and returns a 200
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ng serve returns 200 for non-existent files in the assets folder instead of 404 - user gets redirected to the default route" (#17989)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): use copy-on-write asset processing for non-watch builds
Issues.Body: Optimized asset processing was only being performed when differential loading was enabled.  This change ensures that the optimized approach is used for all builds.  This does not affect `ng serve` usage since it currently requires all application files to be in memory.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): use copy-on-write asset processing for non-watch builds" (#17988)

Issues.Title: Error when running schematics unit test
Issues.Body:
This is my first time working in the world of schematics, so it's quite possible I just don't have this set up correctly. But I've been following the guide on angular.io and some additional blog walkthroughs. I'm wanting to package ng-add and ng-update schematics into a component library, that I already have setup and running well. After setting up the initial plumbing for the ng-add one, I wrote a simple unit test just to validate the setup and as soon as it hits the call to new SchematicTestRunner, it blows up with a ton of Module not found errors, including child_process and fs. In fact i commented out everything in the unit test except the creation of the test runner, just to identify the breaking point. And the schematic itself isn't doing anything yet except returning the tree as-is. Interestingly, the "blank" schematics project doesn't use ng test at all, but instead uses jasmine directly. But with this being in an existing Angular Library with full test suite, i wanted to test in the same way. Any help with this, would be much appreciated! # üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [x] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Issues.Title: [patch] ci: fix dedupe-duplicate-modules flakes
Issues.Body:
Following #17973, which we emitted the stderr when this test failed on CI.

We see that the resolved module order sometimes changes, which is totally fine because of the async nature of the operation.

https://circleci.com/gh/angular/angular-cli/167318#tests/containers/5
```
[DedupeModuleResolvePlugin]: /tmp/angular-cli-e2e-i03vMQ/test-project/node_modules/tslib-1 -> /tmp/angular-cli-e2e-i03vMQ/test-project/node_modules/tslib-1-copy
```

With this change we handle both cases which should eliminate the flakes

(cherry picked from commit bf599e4fac433c0b7041b5fac72d10a1677070cc)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "[patch] ci: fix dedupe-duplicate-modules flakes" (#17984)

Issues.Title: `ng add` installs old package versions in 10.0.0-rc.5
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command - [x] add ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was v9.1.9 ### Description `ng add` installs old versions instead of `latest`. Managed to reproduce it with both `@kendo-angular-buttons` (installs v0.10.1) and `@angular/material` (installs v7.3.7). ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. `npm install -g @angular/cli@next` 1. `ng new ng10-project --defaults --skip-git` 1. `cd ng10-project` 1. `ng add @progress/kendo-angular-buttons` The problem **does not occur** if we specify a version to be installed, e.g. `ng add @progress/kendo-angular-buttons@latest` ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: build: avoid conflicts when publishing snapshot builds
Issues.Body:
For the past year, we've had CI failures when multiple PRs
have been merged. Since we run CI for all landed commits, the
snapshot publish job runs multiple times concurrently and could
end up pushing to the snapshot repositories out of order.

This can result in conflicts when multiple jobs push artifacts
at the same time. e.g. https://circleci.com/gh/angular/components/155407.

We intend to fix this by queuing snapshot publishing across CircleCI
builds. This is done using the CircleCI API. We constantly check the
API to check that there are no previous snapshot jobs running.

Instead of implementing this logic our own, we leverage a CircleCI
orb that provides this functionality.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: avoid conflicts when publishing snapshot builds" (#19737)

Issues.Title: feat(google-maps): allow map to be styled natively instead of through inputs
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description
Currently, the google-map object takes a height and width input which are then coerced to px values. This appears to break whenever a value is provided that isn't a css length unit.

#### Use Case
I'd like to set the height of the google to be `calc(100vh - var(--header-height))`. Unfortunately, because the api is designed to use these inputs as _inline styles_ I'm forced to use `!important` to override the default `500px` values. For example, if I use css in the global scope:

``` css
.map-container {
  height: calc(100vh - var(--header-height));
  width: 100%;
}
```
what you end up with is:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9759954/85430773-92037c80-b54e-11ea-9b99-f91729d4e273.png)
and
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9759954/85430806-9def3e80-b54e-11ea-8f65-683e875ea37f.png)

### Solution

Remove the inputs and allow folks to style the map natively using css.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(google-maps): allow map to be styled natively instead of through inputs" (#19732)

Issues.Title: fix(datepicker): not marking as dirty when invalid value is typed in
Issues.Body:
Currently we only mark the datepicker's `ControlValueAccessor` as dirty if the value changed as a result of the user typing something in. The problem is that typing in an invalid value is parsed to `null` which is the same as the default value, causing it not to be marked as dirty. One small complication here that I've added a test for is that we shouldn't be dispatching change events when typing in invalid values.

Fixes #19726.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(datepicker): not marking as dirty when invalid value is typed in" (#19730)

Issues.Title: feat(tab): Add [showOverflow] input
Issues.Body:
### Motivation

Tabs hide their tab body overflow so that the tab body "slide-in" / "slide-out" animation effect works properly. This can lead to non-obvious visual bugs where drop shadows, ripples, and focus indicators are inadvertently clipped from view. The official guidance is to simply apply inner padding to the tab body, but this can mess with page flow and visual hierarchy if some content is insetted and other content isn't.

### Proposal

If the animation effect is disabled with `[animationDuration]="0"`, tabs no longer need to hide their overflow. Consequently, we should be able to reset the now unnecessary `overflow` styles to `overflow: visible` and instead toggle tab views with `display`.

This PR introduces a new input `[showOverflow]` that does exactly that. Note that if `[animationDuration]` is non-zero, `[showOverflow]` must be `false`.

To reiterate, we'd prefer to simply just *always* remove the `overflow` styles, but they are a hard dependency of the slide animation. AFAICT, there's no way to show overflow while also hiding overflow as tab content slides in-and-out.

If the input and implementation are reasonable, I'm happy to add a few unit tests that validate some styles are set correctly.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(tab): Add [showOverflow] input" (#19729)

Issues.Title: refactor(material/menu): explicitly set aria-expanded to true/false
Issues.Body:
In the context of a submenu trigger it is useful for a screen reader user to
know whether a submenu is open or closed. By specifying the
`aria-expanded` attribute as either true or false it provides an
additional "collapsed" announcement to the user informing them of the
state of the menu trigger when closed.

Issues.Title: refactor(form-field): use lightweight token for optimized treeshaking
Issues.Body:
Currently the `MatFormField` always retains `MatHint`, `MatError`,
`MatPrefix` and `MatSuffix`. These are optional parts of a form-field so
we ideally would not retain those always.

We can achieve this by using lightweight injection tokens for querying
of these directives, instead of using the actual implementations as
query predicate token. The retention was already an issue in View Engine
too, but the issue became more noticeable in Ivy where factories and
definitions are directly attached to the classes.

In the basic case this signifies a reduction of ~800kb, while in the advanced
case (due to the referenced injection tokens), we increase by ~300kb.

Related to #19576
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(form-field): use lightweight token for optimized treeshaking " (#19714)

Issues.Title: bug(CDK/SCROLLING): *cdkVirtualFor causes Property '' does not exist on type 'unknown' with Angular 9 strictTemplates enabled using slice pipe
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Stackblitz can't reproduce an issue with the compiler, so I have uploaded a reproduction repo to github.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Download https://github.com/jahumes/slice-pipe-scrolling-strict-templates
2. Install packages
3. Run npm or yarn start
4. Should see the below errors
```
ERROR in src/app/app.component.html:13:57 - error TS2339: Property 'id' does not exist on type 'unknown'.
    
    13                 (click)="organizationClick(organization.id)">
                                                               ~~
    
      src/app/app.component.ts:9:16
        9   templateUrl: './app.component.html',
                         ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
        Error occurs in the template of component AppComponent.
    src/app/app.component.html:14:28 - error TS2339: Property 'id' does not exist on type 'unknown'.
    
    14             {{organization.id}}
                                  ~~
    
      src/app/app.component.ts:9:16
        9   templateUrl: './app.component.html',
                         ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
        Error occurs in the template of component AppComponent.
```
5. If you remove the pipe (uncomment line 9 from app.component.html), there are no errors in the console. Also, if you keep the slice pipe and comment out lines 1 and 18 and change the `*cdkVirtualFor` on line 2 to an `*ngFor`, then the errors go away. 
6. The issue comes when `strictTemplates` is enabled in the tsconfig.json. If it is false, then the errors go a way

#### Expected Behavior

This should not be returning an error.


#### Environment

- Angular: 9.1.11
- CDK/Material: 9.2.4
- Browser(s): In compiler so all of them
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS 10.15.5
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(CDK/SCROLLING): *cdkVirtualFor causes Property '' does not exist on type 'unknown' with Angular 9 strictTemplates enabled using slice pipe" (#19716)

Issues.Title: MatTabs: How to move all visible tabs at once
Issues.Body:
Hi.
I am using the `<mat-tab-group>` with `mat-tab` element and I can navigate through my list of tabs using the arrows. Is there a way to move all the visible tabs on a single arrow click?

For example: If there are 5 tabs fitting on my available space, starting with tabs 1 to 5, clicking once the 'next arrow' should show the tabs from 6 to 10, hitting twice should show tabs from 11 to 15.

The current behaviour is that on a single click on the arrow, the tabs are moving by one. Can this be configurable?

Thank you!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatTabs: How to move all visible tabs at once" (#19713)
